      The given quadtree is traversed depth-first until the current node's variance is smaller than the variance threshold or until the node has no children (which means that the variance is zero).

      Creates a quadtree by recursively subdividing the initial square, which spans the space from (-1, -1) to (1, 1), until a desired initial resolution is reached.
